alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 12 at 10:37AM CDT until further notice by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Fox River Lower At Waukesha affecting Waukesha County. Oak Creek At South Milwaukee affecting Milwaukee County. Root River At Franklin affecting Milwaukee County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1045 PM CDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oak Creek At South Milwaukee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.1 feet, This level is the 1 percent chance flood meaning that there is a 1 percent chance of the river reaching this level in any given year. Flooding effects are confined mainly to lowland and wooded land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Monday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 07/02/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 5 pm...
